EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (0.0, 0.0))
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill (position: (–16.0, –51.0))  
  • Picked up fuel and restored working status but still reports “output blocked by item on the ground. There is no sink entity in place to accept the output.”
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –49.5))  
  • Pickup: (–15.5, –49.5)  
  • Drop: (–13.5, –49.5)
– Transport Belt (position: (–15.5, –49.5))
– Iron Chest (output sink) (position: (–13.5, –49.5))
– Burner Inserter (position: (–14.5, –47.5)) and associated Iron Chest (position: (–13.5, –47.5))
– Fast Inserter (position: (–12.5, –49.5))  
  • Successfully placed with increased spacing to bridge the drill’s output but remains unconnected via belt

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace (position: (–27.0, –60.0)) [warning: no ingredients to smelt]

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research through integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab (position: (0.5, 2.5))  
– Offshore Pump (position: (–7.5, 25.5))
– Boiler (position: (2.0, 17.5)) [warning: no input liquid, no fluid present]
– Steam Engine (position: (5.5, 5.5)) [warning: not connected to power network, no input liquid]

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine (position: (3.5, 0.5)) [warning: not receiving electricity; cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate]
– Iron Chest (position: (1.5, 0.5))
– Electricity Network via Small Electric Poles (e.g., at positions (3.5, –1.5), (3.5, 2.5), (4.5, 3.5), …)

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of multiple PipeGroups distributed across the map (e.g., positions (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), (–1.5, 21.5), and a working PipeGroup at (–9.5, 9.5))

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitate power distribution and link mined resources.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking the Burner Mining Drill’s output to the designated chests
– An Electricity Network integrated with Small Electric Poles forming an Electricity Group

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Output Sink Placement Issues  
  – Validate candidate positions are free of obstructions before placing an output sink (e.g., Iron Chest) to ensure mined items can be deposited.
  
• Transport Belt Connection Errors  
  – Do not attempt to connect transport belts directly to sink entities like Iron Chests. Always use an inserter as the intermediary to feed items into the sink.
  
• Entity Placement Conflicts  
  – When placement errors occur (e.g., for fast inserter or sink inserter), adjust the spacing, direction, or reference position to avoid collisions with existing entities.
  
• Variable Naming and Definition  
  – Ensure that all variables (such as those for newly placed entities) are properly defined to prevent NameErrors during execution.
  
• (Retained) Crafting and Furnace Resource Shortages  
  – Confirm that required raw materials and fuel are available before engaging smelting and crafting processes.
  
• (Retained) Fluid Connectivity and Intermediate Placement  
  – Verify that fluid connection points remain unobstructed and are correctly aligned between connected entities.

────────────────────────
NAMESPACE
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
  – Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position.  
   • Success: Returns the located entity.  
   • Failure: Raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
  – Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
  – Rotates the given entity to the specified direction for proper alignment.

• insert_item(resource: Any, target: Any, quantity: int) -> Any  
  – Inserts a specified quantity of a resource into the target inventory.

• get_connection_amount(virtual_candidate: Any, boiler_connection: Any, pipe_proto: Prototype.Pipe) -> int  
  – Calculates the number of pipe segments required to establish a fluid connection.

• place_entity_next_to(entity_type: Any, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Any  
  – Attempts to place an entity of the given type adjacent to a reference position using the specified direction and spacing.  
   • Success: As seen in Step 1094, a Fast Inserter was placed.  
   • Failure: Initial attempt in Step 1093 failed due to positional collision.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the offshore pump entity at position (–7.5, 25.5).
• boiler_original (Boiler) – Represents the boiler entity at position (2.0, 17.5).
• candidate_intermediate_offpump (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Offshore Pump.
• candidate_intermediate_boiler (Position) – Candidate connection point for linking the Boiler.
• boiler_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the boiler’s water supply.
• steam_engine_connection_point (Position) – Intended connection point for the Steam Engine’s input.
• pipe_count (int) – Tracks the current number of available pipes.
• distance (float) – Calculated distance for pipeline segments.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of inventory item counts after recent operations.
• virtual_candidate (Position) – Virtual candidate connection point used for manual pipe placement.
